left.title: Is this a free event?
left.content: Yes! Attendance, food, swag, and rental hardware is all completely free! üí∏

left.title: Do I need to be a computer scientist in order to participate?
left.content: Not at all! We aim to host an inclusive environment so anyone from any discipline can attend.

left.title: Do you offer travel reimbursement?
left.content: Unfortunately, we cannot provide travel reimbursements at this time.

left.title: What is there is a change of plans or an emergency?
left.content: In the event of a change of plans or an emergency, we will contact you via email. You can also follow us on Twitter for updates.

left.title: Will there be free food and drinks?
left.content: There will be multiple meals scheduled throughout the event. Drinks and snacks will also be available. üåØ ‚òïÔ∏è

right.title: Is there a theme for the hackathon?
right.content: Nope! Create whatever you heart desires.

right.title: What are the rules?
right.content: The maximum team size is 5 people. All projects must be started from scratch at the start of the hacking period and completed by the designated time. All participants must follow the enforced Code of Conduct.

right.title: Is there a schedule?
right.content: We currently working on the schedule. Once complete it will be available here on the website and will be sent out via email as well.

right.title: What should I bring?
right.content: Bring your laptop, chargers, a valid ID (preferably student), and comfortable clothes. We also recommend a sleeping bag and pillow so you can take advantage of our designated napping zones üò¥

right.title: When and where is it?
right.content: We are still in the early planning stages of the event but are hoping to host it this Fall.
